meanings.definition: To cause (a feeling or situation) to become more intense or severe again.
meanings.sent1: The argument reinflamed when they brought up the old disagreement.
meanings.sent2: Her anger reinflamed when she saw the damage to her car.
meanings.sent3: The situation reinflamed when they accidentally spilled juice on the new carpet.
meanings.sent4: His words reinflamed the tension in the room, making everyone uncomfortable.
meanings.sent5: The memory of the betrayal reinflamed her sense of hurt and disappointment.

meanings.definition: To become more intense or severe again.
meanings.sent1: The pain in his knee reinflamed after he ran for too long.
meanings.sent2: Her fear reinflamed as the storm grew stronger outside.
meanings.sent3: The excitement reinflamed when they announced the surprise guest.
meanings.sent4: The conflict reinflamed, causing chaos in the once peaceful community.
meanings.sent5: The passion in their relationship reinflamed, bringing back the spark they had lost.
